intro: Mikania rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-stemmed vine, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in groups, typical of the daisy family. Mikania rubiginosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
